For those, who don't understand: 

"6. Copy the file XR_3DA.exe from installation directory to /Program Files/THQ/S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Shadow of Chernobyl/bin and overwright existing file."

1) Open a directory, where did you downloaded this game, and where is an "setup.exe"
2) Move this window to right side of your screen.
3) Now click (twice) on "My Computer", then "Local Disk (C:)", then "All Programs", then "THQ", then "S.T.A.L.K.E.R. Shadow of Chernobyl", then "bin", and move this window to the left side of your screen.
4) And the final step is: Move "XR_3DA.exe" from the right window to the left window, but only hold "CTRL" on your keybord too (to copy this file, not to replace)


Now you are ready to play this game.

To anyone having the issue of this (or any other) program you were successful in installing but are required to insert a disc in order to run it, here's a possible solution:

Create an ISO of the program with MagicIso (or similar), then mount the ISO with Daemon Tools (or similar). Then try running the program again.

Using a crack may help, too...

The only other solution would be to buy the software, but where's the fun in that? That's effectively why torrents and cracks were made: To help those who bought the software, but can't find it, to be able to run those annoying programs that require the disc to run. And to aid those of us who can't afford the program to "try it before we buy it".
